page.title: 10FAUNA IN THE PRESTON AREA
page.content: The fauna is varied and the largest animals seen in the area are Roe deer. The herd numbers over 20 and is in_ creasing.They graze on the growing crops and other vegetation and have become a problem to local farmers.The original members of the herd escaped from the deer park at Kings Walden. There are many Muntjak deer also which live in the woodland.Hares,rabbits and grey squirrels are plentiful and foxes are regularly hunted in the area.There are a few badgers in the woodland but they are rarely seen by day.The bird life is extensive and the natural pop_ ulation is enhanced by large numbers of pheasants and a few partridge which are bred in captivity for the shooting season on the two large privately_ owned estates in the locality.
